skill.name: cellxgene-census
skill.description: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data, integrate with scanpy/PyTorch, for population-scale single-cell analysis.
skill.summary: Query CZ CELLxGENE Census (61M+ cells). Filter by cell type/tissue/disease, retrieve expression data...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains documentation and example code only. No executable scripts, network calls, or filesystem access are present.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant single cell data across millions of cells is slow and error prone. This skill provides clear query patterns for scalable analysis.
actual_capabilities: Explain how to open the Census with context managers and versions
Show metadata queries using value filters for cells and genes
Provide AnnData loading patterns for small to medium queries
Describe axis_query batching for out of core processing
Outline PyTorch dataloader setup for model training
limitations: Requires the cellxgene-census Python package and dependencies
Examples focus on human and mouse data only
Large queries can exceed memory without batching
Results depend on the selected Census version

use_cases.title: Survey tissue cell types
use_cases.description: Identify cell types and counts in a tissue before deeper analysis.

use_cases.title: Prepare training data
use_cases.description: Create PyTorch dataloaders with cell type labels for models.

use_cases.title: Compare tissues
use_cases.description: Run consistent filters to compare expression across tissues.

prompt_templates.title: List cell types
prompt_templates.prompt: List unique cell types in human lung with counts. Use is_primary_data == True and show the filter used.

prompt_templates.title: Focused AnnData query
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch AnnData for CD4, CD8A, and FOXP3 in T cells from lung. Include disease and donor metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Batch mean expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute mean expression for FOXP2 and TBR1 in brain using axis_query batches and primary data filters.

prompt_templates.title: Train dataloader
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PyTorch dataloader for liver cells with cell_type labels, batch size 128, and shuffle enabled.

output_examples.input: Show main brain cell types and counts from primary data.
output: Found 42 cell types in brain primary data
Filter used: tissue_general == 'brain' and is_primary_data == True

best_practices: Include is_primary_data == True in most filters
Specify a Census version for reproducible results
Estimate query size before loading AnnData
anti_patterns: Loading large datasets without axis_query batching
Omitting the context manager when opening the Census
Running broad tissue queries without limiting columns

faq.question: Is this compatible with my environment?
faq.answer: It works with Python environments that can install cellxgene-census and dependencies.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Large queries can exceed memory without batching and only human and mouse data are covered.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides patterns for scanpy and PyTorch workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance for querying the public Census dataset.

faq.question: What if my query returns too many cells?
faq.answer: Add stricter filters or switch to axis_query for batch processing.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic dataset search?
faq.answer: It targets the Census schema and query syntax for precise analysis.
